name: Murex
Relationship: Compare: PLAT.; LIL.; SEP. (the latter lacks sexual erethism of MUREX.)

Urine: Urine frequent at night; smells like valerian; constant urging
Female: Dysmenorrhoea and chronic endometritis, with displacement
Leucorrhoea green or bloody, alternate with mental symptoms and aching in sacrum
Menses irregular, profuse, frequent, large clots
Pain in them during menstrual period
Prolapse; enlargement of uterus, with pelvic tenesmus and sharp pains, extending toward breasts; aggravated lying down
Feeling as if something was pressing on a sore spot in the pelvis; worse sitting
Least contact of parts causes violent sexual excitement
Pain from right side of womb to right or left breast

details: The symptoms of the female sexual organs are most prominent, and have been clinically verified. Especially adapted to nervous, lively, affectionate women. Patient weak and run down.
